segment.source: How to Reset a TPM Lockout
segment.target: How to Reset a TPM Lockout

segment.source: How to Reset a TPM Lockout
segment.target: How to Reset a TPM Lockout

segment.source: How to Reset a TPM Lockout
segment.target: How to Reset a TPM Lockout

segment.source: This topic explains how to use the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) to reset a TPM lockout.
segment.target: This topic explains how to use the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) to reset a TPM lockout.

segment.source: TPM lockouts can occur if an end user enters the incorrect PIN too many times.
segment.target: TPM lockouts can occur if an end user enters the incorrect PIN too many times.

segment.source: The number of times that a user can enter an incorrect PIN before the TPM locks varies from manufacturer to manufacturer.
segment.target: The number of times that a user can enter an incorrect PIN before the TPM locks varies from manufacturer to manufacturer.

segment.source: From the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, you can access the centralized Key Recovery data system, which provides a TPM owner password file when you supply a computer ID and associated user identifier.
segment.target: From the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, you can access the centralized Key Recovery data system, which provides a TPM owner password file when you supply a computer ID and associated user identifier.

segment.source: To access the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.
segment.target: To access the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.

segment.source: These roles are groups that administrators create in Active Directory.
segment.target: These roles are groups that administrators create in Active Directory.

segment.source: You can use any name for these groups.
segment.target: You can use any name for these groups.

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.

segment.source: For information about MBAM and TPM ownership, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: For information about MBAM and TPM ownership, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.source: To reset a TPM lockout
segment.target: To reset a TPM lockout

segment.source: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: In the left pane, click Manage TPM to open the Manage TPM page.
segment.target: In the left pane, click Manage TPM to open the Manage TPM page.

segment.source: Enter the fully qualified domain name for the computer and the computer name.
segment.target: Enter the fully qualified domain name for the computer and the computer name.

segment.source: Enter the end user’s Windows log-on domain and user name to retrieve the TPM owner password file.
segment.target: Enter the end user’s Windows log-on domain and user name to retrieve the TPM owner password file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are in the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the user domain and user ID fields are not required.
segment.target: If you are in the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the user domain and user ID fields are not required.

segment.source: From the Reason for requesting TPM owner password file list, select a reason for the request, and click Submit.
segment.target: From the Reason for requesting TPM owner password file list, select a reason for the request, and click Submit.

segment.source: MBAM returns one of the following:
segment.target: MBAM returns one of the following:

segment.source: An error message if no matching TPM owner password file is found
segment.target: An error message if no matching TPM owner password file is found

segment.source: The TPM owner password file for the submitted computer
segment.target: The TPM owner password file for the submitted computer

segment.source: After the TPM owner password is retrieved, the owner password is displayed.
segment.target: After the TPM owner password is retrieved, the owner password is displayed.

segment.source: To save the password to a .tpm file, click the Save button.
segment.target: To save the password to a .tpm file, click the Save button.

segment.source: In the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Reset TPM lockout option and provide the TPM owner password file.
segment.target: In the Manage TPM area of the Administration and Monitoring Website, select the Reset TPM lockout option and provide the TPM owner password file.

segment.source: The TPM lockout is reset and the end user’s access is restored.
segment.target: The TPM lockout is reset and the end user’s access is restored.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not give the TPM hash value or TPM owner password file to end users.
segment.target: Do not give the TPM hash value or TPM owner password file to end users.

segment.source: Because the TPM information does not change, giving the file to end users creates a security risk.
segment.target: Because the TPM information does not change, giving the file to end users creates a security risk.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
